numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice that wealthy applicants have a higher probability of admission to a prestigious institution.
2. I notice that legacy applicants have a higher probability of admission to a prestigious institution.
4. Some lower-class applicants are not legacy applicants.
5. Lower-class non-legacy applicants have a lower probability of admission to a prestigious institution.
6. I wonder whether a donation from a parent of a legacy applicant affects the chance of admission of the applicant.
7. The headline is: Can money buy your education?
